name: carex grisea
description:
Despite
the common name, Wood Gray Sedge is not gray. This dark green sedge grows in
clumps and the leaf blades are hairless. Wood Gray Sedge will
tolerate disturbed sites, so it is often found along wet roadsides or trails in
wet woodlands. 
Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Fall (October) or Spring (April/May).
